attires.name: Tabi
attires.description: Traditional Japanese socks dating back to the 15th century. They have a separation between the big toe and other toes.

attires.name: Geta
attires.description: A form of traditional Japanese footwear that resemble both clogs and flip-flops.

attires.name: Zori
attires.description: Flat and thonged Japanese sandals made of rice straw or other plant fibers, cloth, lacquered wood, leather, rubber, or synthetic materials.
